Description: Epiphone 1966 SG G400 PRO in the TV Silver finish. This finish has a green-ish tint to it, supposedly to look like a vintage TV picture tube color. This finish was a limited run for Epiphone, and I don't see them for sale very often. Mahogany body and mahogany neck, Alnico Classic Pro humbuckers with push/pull coil tap at both of the volume knobs. Grover tuners, 'Epiphone' and fleur de leis design on the headstock done in Abalone, Limited Edition Custom Shop label on headstock rear. Rosewood fretboard with pearloid trapezoid inlays, 3-ply pickguard and 2-ply truss rod cover. The guitar is in excellent condition, with only some pick swirling and a very few faint buckle rash markings. There are no nicks, chips or edge marks on the body, the horns or the headstock. It was hard to get the color in the pictures, so I placed a light blue cloth in a couple of the pictures for contrast. You can also look up the color on the internet for some factory pictures of the finish. The SG sounds great with no buzzing or scratchy pots. Included will be an Epiphone Hard Shell Case, also in excellent condition, with keys. The SG doesn't get played, so I am selling.
Title: Epiphone SG G400 PRO TV Silver, with Epiphone Hard Case
